caption: Table 1: Performance in VirtualHome, ALFRED, and CARLA w.r.t. non-stationarity. We use the 95% confidence interval, using 10 random seeds for VirtualHome and 5 random seeds for both ALFRED and CARLA.
description: This table presents the performance of different models (ZSP, SayCan, ProgPrompt, LLM-Planner, and ExRAP) across three different environments (VirtualHome, ALFRED, and CARLA) under varying degrees of non-stationarity (low, medium, high).  The performance is measured using two metrics: Task Success Rate (SR) and average Pending Steps (PS).  Higher SR indicates better performance, while lower PS means higher efficiency. The confidence intervals are calculated using multiple random seeds to provide a measure of statistical significance.
